info.title: Solar Manager external API
info.description: This is a Solar Manager external communication service

BearerAuth.name: Authorization
BearerAuth.description: Type "Bearer" followed by a space and JWT token.

tags.name: Devices
tags.description:
Device(s) related endpoints.

The sensorId and deviceId are identical. All endpoints will eventually be replaced with /v3 endpoints and will use deviceId instead of sensorId.

get.description:
Get overview data

The response will contain the total number of plants, support contracts, production data, status of installations, monitoring status, autarchy degree, consumption data and total energy for car chargers, water heaters, heat pumps and V2X chargers.
Get information about subscription(s)
Get information about user(s)
Get information about customer(s) as CSV

Get sensor tariffs

The response will contain an array of tariffs with the following fields:
- CurrentEnergyPurchaseTariff1 - current energy purchase tariff 1
- CurrentEnergyDeliveryTariff1 - current energy delivery tariff 1
- CurrentEnergyPurchaseTariff2 - current energy purchase tariff 2
- CurrentEnergyDeliveryTariff2 - current energy delivery tariff 2
Get information about customer
Get user subscription

Get a list of supported devices for the system.

The response will contain a list of compatible devices with their types, labels, hardware, and other properties.
Get information about customer as CSV

Get pie chart for gateway

The response will contain common data from gateway and detailed data for each device if "sensorData" object.

Sensor consumption statistics.

The response will contain the "totalConsumption" field as total consumed power per period of time and consumption will be grouped by days(included into this period).

parameters.description:
some period of time for export
day | week | month
parameters.name: period

get.description:
Consumption statistics for device

The response will contain the ’totalConsumption’ field as total consumed power per period of time and consumption grouped by days(included into this period).

parameters.description:
some period of time for export
 day
  week
  month
parameters.name: period

get.description:
The response contains the timestamp of the last gateway update and the gateway data for that date.

Deprecated as of 2025-06. Will be removed in 2026-06. Replaced with /v3/users/{smId}/data/stream

Get all energy values.

The response returns sensors list with tariff and date values

Get production forecast for the gateway

The response contains a production forecast for the device for the next 3 days.

Deprecated as of 2025-07. Will be removed in 2026-07. Replaced with /v3/users/{smId}/data/forecast

This API will be used for getting detailed information about the gateway by sm_id(Solar Manager ID). Note: If request is emitted by user with role "end user", smId is not required and will be taken from user gateway_id. (Currently Swagger doesn't support this feature, so you need to add smId manually to the request).

Get single sensor

The response will contain general data about sensors(devices). Response type JSON.
Get information about user sensors (devices) such as water heaters, smart plugs etc.
This API will be used for getting detailed information about the user by user id (uId)

Get statistics for gateway

The response will contain the total consumption, production, self-consumption, self-consumption rate and autarchy degree for the specified period of time.

The accuracy parameter is used to determine the level of detail in the statistics. The higher the accuracy, the more detailed the statistics will be.

parameters.description:
low; // we recommend using this accuracy for huge ranges bigger than 1 month
medium; // we recommend using this accuracy for medium ranges, till 1 month
high; // we recommend using this accuracy for small ranges, till 1 week
parameters.name: accuracy

get.description:
The response contains general values of production, consumption, and battery and array with the latest values of temperature, battery, and power for each device. This will be raw data received from the gateway.

Deprecated as of 2025-06. Will be removed in 2026-06. Replaced with /v3/users/{smId}/data/stream

Get tariff

INFO

lowTariff = low tariff price
highTariff = high tariff price
 tariffType = type of the tariff can be single, double, dynamic
 singleTariff = single tariff price 
 provider = provider for dynamic tariff
 isWinterTimeEnabled = if settings for winter season enable
 commonSeasons = settings for seasons
 winterSeason = settings for winter season 
 directMarketing = energy export tariff identifier
This API will be used for getting detailed information about the user tariff settings by smId
Deprecated as of 2025-06. Will be removed in 2026-06. Replaced with /v3/users/{smId}/data/range

parameters.description: data point interval / for now possible to choose only 300 sec
parameters.name: interval

get.description:
The response returns sensor info by type and range

Deprecated as of 2025-06. Will be removed in 2026-06. Replaced with /v3/devices/{deviceId}/data/range

Get string data

The response returns string data by range

The response contains data of last sensor update and sensor"s data for this date. In object "data" will be contained sensor"s signal, power, water temperature or SOC and array of sensor"s errors.

Deprecated as of 2025-06. Will be removed in 2026-06. Replaced with /v3/users/{smId}/data/stream

Get dynamic tariffs for gateway

The response contains the dynamic tariff data for the specified gateway.

Device data

Replaces /v1/data/sensor/{sensorId}/range

Main statistics data

Replaces /v1/consumption/gateway/{smId}/range

The response contain general values of production (pW, pWh), consumption (cW, cWh), and battery (soc, bcW, bcWh, bdW, bdWh) and array with the latest values of power, temperature, battery soc for each device. This will be raw data received from the gateway.

put.description:
Update single sensor

This end-point can change the device's priority in the system. This priority is used internally for better energy consumption optimization.

DEPRECATED Set battery mode

INFO

 batteryChargingMode:
 0 = Passive
 1 = Active
 2 = Charge
 3 = Discharge
 4 = OFF

Set car charger mode

INFO

chargingMode:
 0 = Fast Charge
  1 = Only solar
 2 = Solar & tariff optimized
 3 = Do not charge
 4 = Constant current
 5 = Minimal & Solar
 6 = Minimum charge quantity
 7 = Charging Target(%)

Set heatpump mode

INFO

heatPumpChargingMode:
 0 = noMode
 1 = ON
 2 = OFF
 3 = Only solar
 4 = Solar & tariff optimized
 5 = noControl
 6 = Normal operation
 7 = OEM 14

Set inverter mode

INFO

 activePowerLimit: 
 from 0 to 100

Set smart plug mode

INFO

chargingMode:
 1 = ON
 2 = OFF
 3 = Only Solar
 4 = Solar & tariff optimized
 5 = No control

Set switch mode

INFO

chargingMode:
 0 = noMode
1 = ON
 2 = OFF
 3 = Only Solar
 4 = Solar & tariff optimized
 5 = No control

Set v2x car-charger mode

INFO

chargingMode:
 0 = Fast Charge
  1 = Only solar
 2 = Solar & tariff optimized
 3 = Do not charge
 4 = Constant current
 5 = Minimal & Solar
 6 = Minimum charge quantity

Set water heater mode

INFO

waterHeaterMode:
 1 = ON
 2 = OFF
 3 = Only solar
 4 = Solar & tariff optimized
 5 = noControl
 6 = ECO

Set battery mode

INFO

 batteryMode:
 0 = Standard
 1 = Eco
 2 = peak-shaving
 3 = manual
 4 = tariff optimized
 5 = Standard (Actively controlled batteries) 

 batteryManualMode:
 0 = Charge
 1 = Discharge
 2 = OFF

DataSchema.description: configuration object, specific for each device

signal.description: connection status of the sensor - “connected” or“not connected”.

ip.description: IP address of the device in the local network

updatedAt.description: time of last updating the device

signal.description: connection status of the sensor - “connected” or“not connected”.

updatedAt.description: time of last updating the device

iWh.description: Device energy consumed/imported in [watt-hours] over the specified interval

eWh.description: Device energy produced/exported in [watt-hours] over the specified interval

switchState.description: Switch state for switches, smart plugs, car chargers

cWh.description: Consumption energy in [watt-hour] over the specified interval

pWh.description: Production energy in [watt-hour] over the specified interval

bcWh.description: Battery charging energy in [watt-hour] over the specified interval

bdWh.description: Battery discharging energy in [watt-hour] over the specified interval

iWh.description: Import energy [watt-hour] over the specified interval

eWh.description: Export energy [watt-hour] over the specified interval
